result.execSummary:
The defendant Lyronex T Fleming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work and good time.

miscConds.notes: $38.00 to William W. .  Joint and several with codefendant Tynisha Smith in 14CF460.

BOTH COUNTS:  Pay DNA surcharge, costs, surcharges and disbursements.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Seek and maintain employment.  Job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with William W. or codefendant Tynisha Smith.

Anger management counseling.
Cognitive thinkning intervention counseling.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count one.  Huber for work and good time.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 06/02/14. AR
/from Justice Point, filed. rn
/from Justice Point, filed. rn

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney David K Ziemer.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a brief adjournment for the sentencing.  State had no objection.  Court granted defense request and ordered case continued before Branch 20 and that all terms and conditions of bail remain.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/and Restitution Worksheet, filed. rn
/from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant compliant. rn

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 5/12/14 at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney David K Ziemer.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed, charging defendant as follows:

COUNT 01:
Credit Card - Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), as a Party to a Crime, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. sections 943.41(5)(a), 939.51(3)(a) and 939.05.

COUNT 02:
Disorderly Conduct, a Class B Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b).

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney David K. Ziemer.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All terms and conditions of bail remain; defendant compliant with Justice Point.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Justice Point, filed. rn
/from Justice Point, received and filed. rn

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney David K. Ziemer.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is scheduled for a pretrial/scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All conditions of bail are to continue.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney David K. Ziemer.  James W. Frisch on behalf of Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel needs addtional time to speak to ADA Pucek who is in trial in Branch 20. All conditions of bail continue.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM009595  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/20/14 vf

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney David K Ziemer.  Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in custody. Alex Hall, student intern under the supervision of Randy Sitzberger for Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Koceja-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with William W. and Tynisha Smith (co-actor).

Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Lyronex T Fleming in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
